description: five separate panels; abstract image in bright multicolors with triangles, arcs, zigzags, and whorls, forming abstracted faces playing saxophones of various sorts
signed: LLC on a/left panel in yellow: Phillips \"71\"
text: James Phillips’s "Cosmic Connection" is a bursting, cacophonous and rhythmic homage to visionary musician, composer, and music theorist John Coltrane. Phillips made the piece at a residency at the Studio Museum in Harlem to be the backdrop to a memorial concert to Coltrane at Town Hall, New York that same year. In imagining an uplifting visual counterpart to Coltrane's music and soul, Phillips hit on light. He said, “Sound is sound. I work with the visual manifestations of sound. The visual component to that would be light.”
title: Cosmic Connection
